place.name: THORPE ACHURCH
place.gazetteerText: THORPE-ACHURCH, a parish, with a r. station, in Oundle district, Northampton; on the Peterborough railway, 4 miles NNE of Thrapston. Post town, Oundle. Acres, 1,580. Real property, £2,465. Pop., 209. Houses, 44. The manor belongs to Lord Lilford. The living is a rectory, united with Lilford, in the diocese of Peterborough. Value, £420.* Patron, Lord Lilford. The church was recently restored. Charities, £18. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
